text: deze functie is alleen beschikbaar voor applicatiebeheerders. gebruikersbeheer werkt binnen rve conform roll based acces control. je maakt rollen aan, een gebruiker koppel je vervolgens aan de definieerde rol. doordat je slechts één keer een rol inricht en de gebruikers hieraan koppelt weet je zeker dat je de juiste rechten koppelt en het gaat ook nog eens sneller. rollen toevoegen 1.ga naar filiaal instellingen/rve toegangsrechten 2.kies het tabblad ‘rollen’ 3.kies nieuw 4.een lege rol verschijnt: 5.een rol dien je op 2 zaken te autoriseren: 1. variabelen 2. menupunten 6.kies bijvoorbeeld bewerken in de kolom hoofdmenu. 7.je kunt nu uitzetten wat niet gebruikt mag orden door een bepaalde rol. 8.voor het inrichten van de variabelen is er één veel gebruikte: showmenuoptions = false (hiermee hebben gebruikers geen toegang tot het optiemenu). nopurchaseprice = true (hiermee zien gebruikers geen inkoopprijzen) rollen bewerken 1.ga naar filiaal instellingen/rve toegangsrechten 2.kies het tabblad ‘rollen’ 3.kies bewerken in één van de 2 kolommen om de rol te bewerken account aanmaken 1.ga naar filiaal instellingen/rve toegangsrechten 2.kies ‘nieuw’ 3.vul alle velden in: 4.kies variabelen. vul hier de volgende waarden in: . branch voorkeursfiliaal branches filialen waar de gebruiker in mag loggen language voorkeurstaal company franchise / ondernemer allbranches waarde (true / false): alle filialen zijn beschikbaar nobranches filialen waar de gebruiker niet in mag loggen tip: heeft u een account of rol dat bij bijna alle filialen mag? gebruik dan allbranches = true. waar nodig kun je filialen dichtzetten met de parameter nobranches. onderstaand een nederlandse gebruiker die bij alle filialen mag behalve 2. zijn voorkeursfiliaal is 1.. 5.kies ok om op te slaan de gebruiker kan direct inloggen in rve. in de webplayer zal de gebruiker binnen 15 minuten in kunnen loggen. account bewerken 1.ga naar filiaal instellingen/rve toegangsrechten 2.selecteer de gebruiker en kies kies ‘bewerken 3.vul alle velden in: kies variabelen om ook de variabelen van deze gebruiker te wijzigen: . branch: voorkeursfiliaal (maximaal 1 filiaal) branches: filialen waar de gebruiker in mag loggen language: voorkeurstaal company: franchise / ondernemer 4.kies ok om op te slaan account verwijderen er zijn 2 keuzen: -het account inactief zetten -het account verwijderen een account verwijderen wordt alleen geadviseerd indien deze gebruiker nooit heeft ingelogd in rve. verwijder je de gebruiker, dan ben je mogelijk historie kwijt. 1.ga naar filiaal instellingen/rve toegangsrechten 2.markeer de gebruiker die je wilt verwijderen/inactief zetten 3.3.1 om een account inactief te zetten selecteer je het vinkje, het vinkje veranderd in een kruisje: .2om een account te verwijderen kies je wissen
title: Gebruikersbeheer
category: RVE - RFA - POSFLOW etc.  Customer Help

text: beschrijving en handleiding mars calculatie variabelen bij gebruik van csv bestanden uit rve voor extra artikelvelden. let op: in deze handleiding is er vanuit gegaan dat de com server al is ingericht. de definities van de com server staan in het bestand com _svrs.ini in de map \mars\qlc voorbeeld: [comserver4] comservername=keysvr commachinename= comexternalname=keysvr.keyserv cominitparameter=c:\filename.csv functioncount=7 fnc1name=initcomserver fnc1return=0 .. .. fnc7param4type=10 fnc7param5name=k4 fnc7param5type=10 fnc7param6name=k5 fnc7param6type=10 zie hiervoor ook de handleiding van mars ten behoeve van het “bijladen” van extra artikelvelden in mars vindt er elke nacht 4:00 uur een export plaats van de stamgegevens van de artikelkaart in drie bestanden. à sortering artikelnummer rve en à sortering artikelnummer fabrikant deze worden middels twee makro functies in rve uitgevoerd. (88 en 98) tevens vindt er een export plaats van de interfiliaaldata van elk artikel van een heel jaar. selectie alleen filiaal 99. deze export vindt plaatst door middel van een mrt opdracht in mars waaruit een csv bestand wordt gegenereerd. à sortering artikelnummer fabrikant alle drie bestanden worden geplaatst in de map: u:\ mars opbouw van deze bestanden: de velden staan op één regel gescheiden door een puntkomma. en veldnaam ($ = alfanumeriek) veldinhoud artikel.csv artikel2.csv leeg artikelnummer rve of artikelnummer fabrikant $omschrijving artikelomschrijving $matchcode artikelmatchcode $kenmerk1 artikelkenmerk 1 $kenmerk2 artikelkenmerk 2 $kenmerk3 artikelkenmerk 3 $tekst1 extra artikeltekst 1ste regel $kleurnr eigen kleur nummer $kleur eigen artikelkleur $seizoen artikelseizoenskenmerk $fabrikant fabrikantnummer $fabrikantkleur fabrikant kleur $fabrikantartikelnummer artikelnummer van de fabrikant $laatstevkdatum artikel verkoopdatum (laatste) $laatstegodatum artikel goederenontvangst datum (laatste) $leverdatum; leverdatum laatste bestelling inkoopprijs artikelinkoopprijs (netto) verkoopprijs artikelverkoopprijs aktieprijs artikel aktie verkoopprijs vkak1prijs artikel speciale prijs1 avk1 vkak2prijs artikel speciale prijs2 avk2 voorbeeld artikel.csv: 122000032;linnen,jukstuk,bordu;e12;;70 %;;80817; 240;olijf;71; 9,95; 3,00; 0,00; 0,00; 122000034;4.5"fine twill br lu;r32;;70 %;;80901; 240;olijf;71; 228;240;60151;14.07.2009;14.04.2007;dd.mm.jjjj; 3,85; 10,95; 3,00; 0,00; 0,00; voorbeeld artikel2.csv: 0110243;poplin aop dessin,;f13;persival;;;z50265; 255;granny;01; 135;granny01;322000142;03.03.2010;14.01.2010;15.12.2009; 1,98; 12,95; 12,95; 0,00; 0,00; 0110244;poplin, bulky zakken;d55;;;;z50268; 602;donker grijs;01; 135;dolphin01;322000144;02.03.2010;22.01.2010;15.12.2009; 4,55; 13,95; 13,95; 0,00; 0,00; 0110244;poplin, bulky zakken;c55;;;;z50268; 470;fuchsia;01; 135;fuchsia01;322000145;03.03.2010;22.01.2010;15.12.2009; 4,55; 13,95; 13,95; 0,00; 0,00; veldnaam (“ “ = alfanumeriek) veldinhoud “artikel nummer fabrikant" artikelnummer van fabrikant "artikel nummer fabrikant-naam" leeg "boekingsdatum" leeg "$boekingsdatumnaam" dag en datum van if boeking "iftot_aant" totaal aantal interfiliaal voorbeeld artikel3.csv "0111211";;;"mo: 01-02-2010";-270 "0111212";;;"fr: 12-02-2010";-272 "0111213";;;"mo: 25-01-2010";-308 "0111214";;;"mo: 04-01-2010";-314 toepassen van de extra variabelen door middel van een calculatie is het mogelijk de velden in het csv bestand in een mars lijst te verwerken. belangrijk is te bepalen of de sortering op eigen artikelnummer of fabrikant-artikelnummer is ingesteld. afhankelijk daarvan dient de juiste sleutel (key) te worden gekozen welke gekoppeld zijn aan het bestand artikel?.csv (? = 1 of 2) instelling in mars: sortering in mars artikelnummer à artikel.csv à keyserv_13 sortering in mars artikelnummer fabrikant à artikel2.csv à keyserv_14 à artikel3.csv à keyserv_15 (alleen if_datum) calculatievariabelen in het tabblad design is het mogelijk om ‘calculatievelden’ toe te voegen. middels dergelijke velden kunnen berekeningen, welke niet als standaard variabele zijn opgenomen, worden toegevoegd. het is niet mogelijk om op calculatievariabelen te sorteren. ook voor het toepassen van de extra velden uit de csv bestanden dient een calculatieveld te worden aangemaakt. omdat de waarden als het ware als sleutelwaardes zijn vastgelegd. de meeste calculatievelden voor de artikelvelden zijn al aangemaakt en kunnen op de normale wijze worden gekozen. nieuw item toevoegen wanneer in het tabblad design op lege cel met de rechtermuis wordt geklikt, kan gekozen worden voor de functie calculatie. het volgende scherm verschijnt vervolgens. of r-muisknop op de groep waaraan het item moet worden toegevoegd. kies daarna toevoegen veld (ctrl-i) voordeel dat hier meteen de juiste groep wordt ingevuld. vul een logische postnaam in. bijv. artkenmerk1 klik in het vak calculatie typ een = teken indien het een alfanumerieke variabele betreft typ dan een $ bij een numerieke variabele, geen $ teken klik op het tabblad functies en kies de juiste keysvr. zie hierboven. vanwege de opbouw van de layout en sortering moet gekozen worden voor keysvr_?.getdatabykey1 in dit geval is de sortering fabrikant artikel dus is gekozen voor keysvr_14.getdatabykey1 tussen de haakjes moet nu de verwijzing worden ingevuld de omschrijving van de variabele tussen enkele aanhalingstekens plaatsen. zie beschrijving van de kolomteksten. (inclusief $ teken indien nodig) =$keysvr_14.getdatabykey1('$kenmerk1',key.artikel nummer fabrikant) !! belangrijk is dat de exacte koptekst van de csv kolom in de formule wordt opgenomen. typ een komma gevolgd door het woord key en een punt =$keysvr_14.getdatabykey1('$kenmerk1',key.artikel nummer fabrikant) daarna volgt de tekst van het niveau waarop gesorteerd wordt. =$keysvr_14.getdatabykey1('$kenmerk1',key.artikel nummer fabrikant) !! belangrijk is dat de exacte tekst van de sortering in de formule wordt opgenomen. druk op ok

text: set up e-mail account parameters of connection to the e-mail server are configurated in this file. parameters of connection are entered into the e-mail settings part. already set parameters can be tested by use of the following button . fields description: mail server (smtp) mail server. ip address or server name. for example 192.168.1.1 or mail.xdomcz.cz. server port number mail server port number. my smtp server requires authentication here is determined, whether mail server requires authentication. please, use fileds user name and password for authentication. user name user name for authentication. password password for authentication. choose the job to send email send e-mail this function will send e-mail. parameters besides default parameters, for more see the „no function“ description, also the following parameters can be set. parameters description: from user address. this field is read noly. please, use edit message for editing. to list of recipients. this field is read noly. please, use edit message for editing. cc if you add a recipient's name to this box in a message, a copy of the message is sent to that recipient, and the recipient's name is visible to other recipients of the message. this field is read noly. please, use edit message for editing. bcc if you add a recipient's name to this box in a message, a copy of the message is sent to that recipient, and the recipient's name is not visible to other recipients of the message. this field is read noly. please, use edit message for editing. subject mail subject. this field is read noly. please, use edit message for editing. attachements list of attachements. this field is read noly. please, use edit message for editing. message message body. this field is read noly. please, use edit message for editing. edit message enables adit message. the function/environment variables (%xxx%) can be used. mail message editing window for mail message editing is opened when we click on edit message button. it is possible to enter the following parameters for mail message. parameters description: from user address. to list of recipients. cc if you add a recipient's name to this box in a message, a copy of the message is sent to that recipient, and the recipient's name is visible to other recipients of the message. bcc if you add a recipient's name to this box in a message, a copy of the message is sent to that recipient, and the recipient's name is not visible to other recipients of the message. subject mail subject. attachements list of attachements. new attachement is added. current attachement is deleted. enables to edit a current attachement. use file as message determines, whether a file will be used as mail message body. message file name file which will be used as mail message body. enables to edit message file. enables to find message file.
title: Send Email with KMaster

text: in case you have already opened a printout in pos(making it not being shown in the ddd pos printouts anymore) and need to see it again, in case of a reprint etc. it can be found following this path in file explorer: c:/pos/reports sort after newest to see what has been printed out most recently
title: Accessing earlier printouts from POS (RIAB)

text: if you have created an item transfer on the pos and want to delete it, do this: log into the pos, click the ddd button and choose item transfer click in from this store and, if the item transfer is still present, select it and click go to item transfer. tick the delete box and click accept
title: Delete RIAB item transfer on POS

text: log into pos with a user with administrator rights. change fixed date: fixed date on the receipt, that shows the last date for exchange option. (usually used around christmas) change note type: 1 = label 2 = receipt change note variable date: how many days after purchase the customer can exchange the item
title: Exchange note setup

text: on the main interface of ddd pos, as shown in the below screenshot, you can see different information regarding a store. it can tell us if the pos is a riab pos and to which ddd server it is connected. moreover, it also shows us the client id including terminal number for that store and which version of the pos program is currently running on the pos. sometimes, due to internet instability in the store, the pos is not active in communication with ddd api and all data from the pos is not sent to backoffice in that case. it is important to notice all the times, that the pos is in fact communicating with ddd server. an example is shown below where no dddweb with a specific number can be seen. in that case, the solution is to restart the pos programme and it can be done by simply writing restart in the clerk field. after restart, you will observe that the pos is now connected to the ddd webserver again.
title: POS - not communicating with DdD API/Server.

text: first make sure you have new batteries in your scanner (aaa) if you have not received them from us. if there is still an open inventory (you cannot start a new inventory if the previous one has not been completed), it must either be updated or, if the inventory is older than 1 year, deleted. attention! to delete, you need to be logged in with a user with a password. otherwise you cannot delete the inventory data. (to setup a password for a user, please click here.) update: delete: start inventory sign into the pos and click on the ddd button under inventory, click start inventory set date for update as at and inventory as at, choose inventory type total and click start. scan the articles with the inventory scanner. click empty scanner and then press 9 on the scanner to start the transfer of data. attention! if the scanner won't transfer the data to the pc, this can mean that the scanner cradle is not connected to the right com-port. this is not a question of which physical usb port it is connected to, but rather which com-port windows has given the scanner cradle. the cradle must always be connected to com7. if you don't know how to change this, please call our support hot line or read more here. usually, it takes about ½-1 hour for the data to be transferred to backoffice. it can take longer if other shops are running inventory at the same time. click order inventory list. if the list is empty, the data is still in transit. add corrections if you have any. you can order as many inventory lists as you wish as long as the inventory is still active. as soon as it has been updated, you can no longer order these lists. once you are satisfied with your inventory, you need to order the closing print before you can update and thereby complete your inventory. click order inventory list again and tick closing print, then click order attention! it is advisable to wait until the closing print has turned up and you have either saved or printed it before you update and thereby close your inventory, as you will not be able to order another printout once the inventory has been closed. now you can update your inventory by clicking update and entering the code "status" in the inventory code field and thereby close it.
title: Inventory on a RIAB POS

text: if youre unable to find a printed list in ddd pos, it can possibly be found saved in a folder in windows. follow the path shown in the below image, and you will find your printouts
title: Location of printed lists from POS (RIAB)

text: note: this functionality is no longer supported. custom email receipts are supported when a retailer has their own sendgrid account. within sendgrid they must create an api key through settings > api keys and record/copy the key to be used. within sendgrid a dynamic template can then be created.this is done using templates > transactional you can then create and format a template but it must be a dynamic template. it can be formatted and structured however you like, but you should use the following variables in triplicate {{{curlybraces}}} and imagine will replace these with the content from the transaction. {{{header}}} {{{items}}} {{{total}}} {{{vats}}} {{{payments}}} {{{customernumber}}} {{{footer}}} {{{barcode}}} {{{cardreceipt}}} the template id is then required to configure imagine to use your custom template. the custom receipt template can then be implemented by k3 as a shop feature through the support platform. please contact your local support team for more details. feature name: receiptemail feature values: name: sendgridreceiptemailtemplateid, type: string, value: templateid taken from sendgrid name: sendgridreceiptemailapikey, type: string, value: apikey taken from sendgrid a sample/getting started template is shown below. - custom!!!!!! custom!!!!!! thanks for your purchase! please find attached your receipt and below an overview of your purchased items. {{{header}}} {{{items}}} {{{total}}} {{{vats}}} {{{payments}}} {{{customernumber}}} {{{footer}}} {{{barcode}}} {{{cardreceipt}}}
title: Custom Email Receipts

text: if you need to use a different language on the k3 printer, you can follow these steps to set the language within the printer itself: download the printer tool from https://rongtatech.com/rp820_download and connect the thermal printer to your computer. note the com port it connects to, which can be found in the device manager. start up the printertool.exe and configure the printer by setting the com port to the one it's connected to and hit "configure the port." set the baud rate to 38400 and then hit "set printer." on the first tab, set the code page to "chinese" and set the baud rate to 38400. hit "set" and the printer should beep. on the "big5" tab, set the emulation mode to "epson esc/pos" and language to "chinese gb 18030." hit "set" on both options. on the first tab again, hit "self-test." the printer should print out its configuration, and the code page at the top should now read "gbk" along with some chinese characters. unplug the printer and plug it back into your connector, then reboot your connector. ssh onto the connector and change the docker-compose.yml file by adding the following configuration to the arm gateway container as an environment variable: "encodingcodepagevalue: 54936" reboot your connector again.
title: Changing the K3 Printer Language

text: to group data in the item data performance table, follow these steps: click and hold the header you want to group by (e.g., "shop"), and drag it into place. if you want to remove a column header from the grouping, perform the reverse action by dragging it from its position and dropping it back into the table where you want the header to be placed. notes the table will automatically update as you add, remove and alter positions of the headers. headers placed furthest to the left will automatically be the major grouping, whilst headers further to the right will be subsequently more minor groupings. the example below explains this in more detail. columns that display variable digital denominations, large blocks of text and other limitations cannot be grouped. you will not be able to drop these headers in the 'drag and drop' area. in items, examples of the headers that cannot be grouped are: qty on-hand value on-hand qty on-order sales price example of grouping with a single column: once you group the data, the item data performance table will display the information in a different format, showing the groups. in this case, it will be grouped by "shops." you can use the arrow next to each shop's name to expand and view more detailed information. example of grouping with multiple columns: if you choose multiple headers to group by, you will have a stack of groups. for example, you may have "shops" as the major header, and within each shop, you can further group by "date". to change the hierarchy of the data, arrange the groups in the desired order. the data will stack based on the order of the groups you arrange with major priority to the left, moving to minor priority as you move to the right.
title: Grouping Catagories

text: to group data in the sales data performance table, follow these steps: click and hold the header you want to group by (e.g., "shop"), and drag it into place. if you want to remove a column header from the grouping, perform the reverse action by dragging it from its position and dropping it back into the table where you want the header to be placed. notes the table will automatically update as you add, remove and alter positions of the headers. headers placed furthest to the left will automatically be the major grouping, whilst headers further to the right will be subsequently more minor groupings. the example below explains this in more detail. columns that display variable digital denominations, large blocks of text and other limitations cannot be grouped. you will not be able to drop these headers in the 'drag and drop' area. in sales examples of the headers that cannot be grouped are: cost sales qty tax profit example of grouping with a single column: once you group the data, the data performance table will display the information in a different format, showing the groups. in this case, it will be grouped by "shops." you can use the arrow next to each shop's name to expand and view more detailed information. example of grouping with multiple columns: if you choose multiple headers to group by, you will have a stack of groups. for example, you may have "shops" as the major header, and within each shop, you can further group by "date". to change the hierarchy of the data, arrange the groups in the desired order. the data will stack based on the order of the groups you arrange with major priority to the left, moving to minor priority as you move to the right.
title: Grouping Catagories

text: table of contents step 1 - create fiskaly api keys step 2 - k3 consultant to add the fiskaly shop feature step 3 - connector setup step 4 - create purchaser agency setup step 5 - generate settings document step 6 - k3 consultant to configure the docker compose file setup to get started with fiskaly, follow these steps to set up your account and integrate it with imagine. you will need to speak to your k3 consultant to enable certain features, ensure you have made arrangements for this before starting this process. step 1 - create fiskaly api keys: 1. create an account on fiskaly at https://dashboard.fiskaly.com/. 2. go to the "settings" section and select "api keys." 3. click on "create api key" and provide a name for the api key. 4. make note of the generated api key and api secret. step 2 - k3 consultant to add the fiskaly shop feature: your k3 consultant will add a shop feature for you. they will need to know your tenant name or id let your k3 consultant know which shop(s) need fiskaly setting up for. for each shop they will create a new shop feature with the name, type and group of "fiscalization" with the following values: name type key and value active boolean true microserviceurl string http://ms-fiskaly/api/v2.0/ apidetails string { "apikey":"xxxx", "apisecret":"xxxx", "vatrates": "20,5,0", "skipqrprint":false, "itemdescription":"parameter2", "itemid": "parameter3" } note: the following details are required to be passed to your k3 consultant [apikey] - is the api key as obtained in step 1 [apisecret] - is the api secret as obtained in step 1 [vatrates] - represents the vat percentages used for vat codes in fiskaly. where there are more than one rate these should be separated by a comma i.e. "20,5,0" for 20% 5% and 0% [skipqrprint] - set skipqrprint to true if you want to skip qr code generation and printing on the receipt. see the 'how to use fiskaly' page [itemdescription] - this value is "parameter2" and is used to map item details from imagine. no additional detail is required for this key [itemid] - this value is "parameter3" and is used to map item details from imagine. no additional detail is required for this key step 3 - connector setup: 1. in the pos admin module select "k3 connector manager" 2. against each connector, you will find the tssguid, client id, and a button to generate the fiscalization id. click the button to generate the necessary ids for fiskaly for each desired connector. step 4 - create purchaser agency setup: 1. in the back office module select fiskaly from the menu. 2. click on the "register purchaser agency" button to create a new purchaser agency. 3. select the connector for which you want to create the purchaser agency. the address fields will be populated based on the assigned shop, but you can make changes if needed. 4. fill in the remaining fields and click "register purchaser agency" to create the record in fiskaly. 5. end-of-day transactions will now be associated with this purchaser agency. step 5 - generate settings document: once all connectors and purchaser agencies are registered, you can press "settings document" on the fiskaly screen. this will generate a pdf document containing all the fiskaly settings that have been created and set up. step 6 - k3 consultant to configure the docker compose file: your k3 consultant will need to access each connector associated with fiskaly (step 3 above) and check the configuration of the docker compose file used by the connector. they will need to: 1. ensure that the latest "deviceworker_devicegateway" image is used. 2. add the following line to the environment variables for the "deviceworker_devicegateway" section: note: replace [name] with the appropriate value, and make sure to use the correct api url. name value fiscalizationgwurl ${api_url}/fiscalization/
title: How to setup Fiskaly

text: to add a new label template, simply click on the "add label template" button. to create a label template, first, give it a name, and then copy or type your zpl code into the designated template field. after completing these steps, use the save button to save your template. if you wish to exit without saving any changes, click on cancel to return to the overview menu. if you have set up any custom attributes or dimension templates, they will also be available for selection on the page. for more information on this, please refer to the variable section.
title: Adding a New Template

text: to edit an existing label template, click on the name of the label. this will open a new page where you can edit the template attributes. it is important to note that there is no "restore" option after deleting a template, so you will need to start again using the "add template" button. back takes you back to the overview page. test label select test label from the top menu of the open design. select a shop this will be the shop where your barcode printer is located. select the connector this is the connector your barcode printer is attached to. valid barcode key or scan in the barcode of an item. print sends the template design and item details to the barcode printer. delete after a save, you can delete your template if not required. save saves any changes made to the label template. variables in the zpl template, you can include various variables in curly brackets { }. these variables will link to the data of the item you are trying to print and will be converted into zpl commands (such as field data (^fd)) before being sent to the printer. it is important to note that the variable names are case sensitive. if a value cannot be found for a specific variable, then no data will be printed on the label. {barcode} - as listed for each item as the barcode in the matrix tab of an item. {currency} - default currency designator of the tenant in iso 4217 format. {customattribute|} - see custom variable / dimension / sales price for formatting details. {dimension|} - see custom variable / dimension / sales price for formatting details. {discountamount} - see discount labels in item management. this variable will show the value shown in the value field when type value is selected. {discountpercent} - see discount labels in item management. this variable will show the value shown in the percentage field when type percentage is selected. {itemdescription} – as listed for the item in the matrix tab under description. {itemmanufactureritemnumber} – as listed for the item in the matrix tab under manufacture item no. {itemname} – as listed for the item in the matrix tab under name. {itemno} - as listed for each item as the item no in the item list. see details for further details especially as this number cannot be altered after item creation. {itemvariantdescription} – is system set at item creation. it is a concatenation of dimension names set against the item. see the {dimension|} variable for individual elements. {itemvendoritemnumber} – as listed for the item in the matrix tab under vendor item no. {price} – as listed for the item in the matrix tab under sales price. this is always in the default currency, for alternative currencies see the {salesprice|} variable. {salesprice|} - see custom variable / dimension / sales price for formatting details. {textline} – used by the system for arbitrary data, such as the text field in discount labels. not user configurable. {currentprice} – this displays the current price via the pos within the item lookup list. note: the price may be affected by ppe price changes and can differ from the {salesprice|} due to time based price changes. {itemvendorname} – the assigned vendor in the summary tab of an item. {masteritemno} – prints the master item number as shown on the summary tab for the item.
title: Editing a New Template

text: custom variable to print the value of a custom attribute for an item, you can use the custom attribute variable. as an item can have multiple attributes, it is necessary to specify which attribute value to print using the variable. the custom attribute variable requires a single argument, which is the that defines the custom attribute id to use. on the printed label, the data in the value field of the specified custom attribute for that item will be printed. custom variables are structured as {customattribute|} to use this variable, you need to replace with the actual id of the custom attribute you want to print. the pipe character (|) must be used to separate the variable name from the argument. you can find the ids of all custom attributes listed on the custom attribute overview page under item - custom attributes. the variable will then print the value of the specified custom attribute for the item on the label. to insert the correct custom attribute variable on the label template, simply place the cursor where you want the variable and select it from the custom attribute list. the variable and argument will be inserted for you. dimension variable the dimension variable prints the value of dimensions for an item. you need to specify which dimension value to print since an item can have multiple dimensions. to determine the range of dimensions for an item, check the matrix tab for that item. the dimension view also displays the values applied to an item. the dimension variable requires a single argument , which indicates the dimension sequence id to use. you can find dimension sequences in the dimension view of the matrix tab for the item. the id of the far left-hand dimension sequence is 1, and the id of the far right-hand column is 10. select the current dimension sequence for the argument. dimension variables are structured as {dimension|} to use the dimension variable, replace the argument with the value of the dimension sequence id to print. the resulting label will show the value given for the item at the associated dimension sequence id. the pipe character (|) should be used to delimit the variable name from the argument. sales price variable the sales price variable allows you to display the value of an item in different currencies on the label. to specify which currency to print, you need to use the argument. this argument must be iso 4217 compliant and can only be one of the currencies listed in the matrix tab for the item. the available currencies are part of the value selectors and are labeled as "sales price." the variable is structured as: {salesprice|} to create the label, replace the argument with the 3-letter currency code of the currency you want to print. the label will display the value of the item in the corresponding currency field shown in the matrix tab. be sure to use the pipe character (|) to separate the variable name from the argument.
title: Custom Variable / Dimension / Sales Price

text: table of contents modifier groups modifier groups list create a modifier group number picker example. modifier groups modifier groups enable you to apply certain prescribed modifications to an item. note that you can only modify an item or a bundle main item, but not a bundle group item. you would use a modifier group if you wish to add one or more variable modifiers to a particular item. modifiers can have additional prices added on top of the item price. for instance, suppose you order a cup of coffee. you choose a latte but would also like to select your preferred type of milk, an extra shot of espresso, and a flavour of syrup. this would require three modifier groups: "milk": this modifier group lists the milk options available, such as semi skimmed, skimmed, whole, oat, soy, and almond. "shots": this modifier group includes the optional extra shots available. "syrups": this modifier group provides the syrup choices. please note that modifiers are not currently linked to items within imagine and do not affect the stock. modifiers appear in the front-end apps, similar to the example shown below: modifier groups list a modifier group list displays all the existing modifier groups that you have currently set up. from this list, you can create new modifier groups or select an existing one to view or edit its details. note that you cannot delete modifier groups, as they may be linked to other groups for which sales have already been registered. create a modifier group to begin creating modifiers use the this will then open up to the page below. number picker uses a +/- button to increase and decrease selection amounts. can be used for items like "extra shot". checkbox buttons uses tick boxes for selections. can be used for items like a sandwich with different fillings like lettuce, tomatoes or onion. name the name is used internally. display name the name is seen by front-end users. number picker example. you can add/edit as many different number pickers into your modifier group as required within the table. to add more modifiers use the to add a new line. image enter a url for an image to be shown against the modifier in the front-end apps. only .bmp, .gif, .jpg and .svg type images are supported. name the name of the modifier as it appears in the front-end apps. itemno used for integration purposes, you can link a modifier to an existing imagine item which can then be related to a third-party erp system item. default value the number you get by default upon selection. min the minimum value you can enter for the modifier. max the maximum number allowed to be entered for the modifier. sales price optional sales prices for modifiers that get added to the price from the default value. as an example, suppose you have set a default value of 1 for shots, and each additional shot costs £1.10. in this case, the price for each shot added will be added to the item price. however, if the default value is 1, but you have set the minimum value to 0, then the price will not be subtracted if the default shot is removed. this means that the customer cannot lower the base price of the item by removing the modifiers. ensure you save the individual rows before trying to add a new row or save the group. it will only save changes which have been individually saved in that table. example coffee price: £3.00 shot price: £1.00 default shots: 2 minimum shots: 1 number of shots coffee total price reason 1 £3.00 the base price is £3.00 and they have removed 1 shot, but you do not have the cost of the shot removed for your default shots. 2 £3.00 the default number of shots, therefore default coffee price applies. 3 £4.00 2 default shots are included in the price, and 1 additional shot for £1. 4 £5.00 2 default shots included in the price, s additional shots for £2. checkbox button example. checkbox buttons are a type of modifier that allows you to provide one or more selectable options to customers, both as optional or mandatory selections. they are called checkbox buttons because they appear as clickable buttons that resemble checkboxes, which can be easily selected with a touch screen. these are particularly useful for providing choices of fillings for sandwiches or toppings for pizzas, for example. customers can select one or more options or none of them, depending on their preferences. name this should be the name used internally. display name this should be the name seen by front-end users. min the minimum value you can enter for the modifier. max the maximum number allowed to be entered for the modifier checkbox buttons are a way to offer optional or mandatory selections to customers, where they can choose one or more options from a list. if the modifier is not mandatory, the minimum value should always be 0, while if you want to ensure that at least one modifier is always selected, set the minimum to 1. the maximum value is typically set to 1, to limit the number of selections to one per group. however, for optional toppings, you may choose to set a higher limit. to create or modify modifiers, use the table below. you can add, delete, or modify rows as needed. remember to save each row before attempting to add a new one or save the group, as changes are only saved for rows that have been individually saved within the table. image enter an image url this will be shown against the modifier at the front end. note: only .bmp / .gif / .jpg /.svg image types are supported. name the name of the modifier as it appears in the front-end apps. itemno used for integration purposes, you can link a modifier to an existing imagine item which can then be related to a third-party erp system item. default value - if the button is selected by default. for example, in a latte case, you might have semi skimmed selected by default. sales price optional sales prices for modifiers that get added to the price of the default value. when you select a syrup for your coffee, an additional charge of £0.50 will be added to the item price. however, if the syrup is set as a default selection, the charge for it will not be subtracted from the item price. you can also set higher prices for more premium modifiers to increase revenue. keep in mind that any additional charges for modifiers will be added to the item price, so the final price of the item may vary based on the selections made.
title: Create a Modifier Group

text: to group detailed data in the movement data table, follow these steps: click and hold the header you want to group by (e.g., "shop"), and drag it into place. if you want to remove a column header from the grouping, perform the reverse action by dragging it from its position and dropping it back into the table where you want the header to be placed. notes the table will automatically update as you add, remove and alter positions of the headers. headers placed furthest to the left will automatically be the major grouping, whilst headers further to the right will be subsequently more minor groupings. the example below explains this in more detail. columns that display variable digital denominations, large blocks of text and other limitations cannot be grouped. you will not be able to drop these headers in the 'drag and drop' area. in movements examples of the headers that cannot be grouped are: cost (tenant) cost (shop) qty item description master item description example of grouping with a single column: once you group the data, the movement data table will display the information in a different format, showing the groups. in this case, it will be grouped by "shops." you can use the arrow next to each shop's name to expand and view more detailed information. example of grouping with multiple columns: if you choose multiple headers to group by, you will have a stack of groups. for example, you may have "shops" as the major header, and within each shop, you can further group by "date". to change the hierarchy of the data, arrange the groups in the desired order. the data will stack based on the order of the groups you arrange with major priority to the left, moving to minor priority as you move to the right.
title: Grouping Categories

text: table of contents adding a new price list search for an existing price list column chooser edit item prices edit variable item prices using the search item fields certain companies may maintain multiple price lists that are specific to different shops or locations. these price lists are established and utilized when transferring or relocating items or inventory between various locations or businesses. if you haven't set any price lists yet, you'll notice that the price list table appears empty and shows a message that says "no data". adding a new price list step 1: to begin creating a price list click the +add price list button. step 2: provide a new name for the price list that can be easily referenced. then, select the appropriate source and destination from the dropdown menu. step 3: click the +create price list. step 4: to begin populating your price list, you can use the items/vendor and hierarchy dropdowns to filter for specific items see using the "search item fields" for more information. alternatively, you can utilize the +add items button to add items directly. step 5: to add items directly, click on the +add items button to open a new window where you can further filter your search. you can use the search box to find items by information such as item number, vendor, and name. you can also use the "show inactive" toggle to view inactive items. step 6: after selecting the items, you can click on the "add items" button by marking the checkbox next to each item. step 7: your items will now be listed in the home page, from here you can set the prices or delete items if necessary. step 8: to modify the price of an item, simply select the "edit" icon and input the updated price. remember to click on the "save" icon to ensure the changes are saved. if you wish to remove an item, click on the "bin icon" and confirm the deletion. search for an existing price list if you have an existing price list, you can utilize the search fields in combination with the dropdown menu to refine your search results. search for name this is the name given to the price list at creation. source this is the source that was selected during the creation of the price list. destination this is the destination that was selected during the creation of the price list. column chooser when adding items from the items list you can use to column chooser to narrow down which columns you see. click the column chooser icon and from here you can drag and drop columns depending on the information you wish to see. edit variable item prices a parent item may have variables that are set, such as items that come in various colors or sizes. if these variables are available, they will be displayed below using the dropdown icon. you have the option to set individual prices for each variable, if applicable. using the search item fields you can add specific items using the item search fields. items all: this will search all items. only items with prices: this will search all items with a price set. only items without prices: this will search all items without a price set. vendor select the vendors available to your tenant. hierarchy this is the item level which was set when the item was created. search this can be used to narrow down the search using a item number or item name.
title: Prices

text: table of contents create a new questionnaire deleting a questionnaire duplicating a supplier questionnaire viji track utilizes corporate social responsibility (csr) questionnaires to assess suppliers' dedication to sustainable and ethical business practices. these questionnaire forms are designed for items that assist entities in obtaining more information by allowing them to assign specific questionnaires directly at the purchase order line level. there are various reasons to employ these questionnaires, including ensuring compliance with legal or regulatory requirements, identifying potential risks associated with suppliers' business practices, enhancing reputation, and gaining increased visibility into the supply chain. by completing the questionnaire, suppliers can demonstrate their commitment to sustainability and ethical business practices, which, in turn, helps them maintain their relationship with viji track and improve their business practices. create a new questionnaire 1. to begin creating a new questionnaire click the "create questionnaire (items)". 2. give the questionnaire a suitable name and click "select commitments" to move on. 4. here, you can construct your "questionnaires". simply drag the desired questions from the right-hand section and drop them into the left-hand section to add them to the questionnaire. 5. after creating the questionnaire, you now have multiple options of where to assign it. all purchase order lines: q: which status po> custom selection: all purchase order lines this action will link your questionnaire to all your "new" or "in progress" purchase orders, excluding those that have been archived. custom selection tbd deleting a questionnaire you have the option to delete a questionnaire by selecting the 3 dots and selecting "delete". an option will appear asking to confirm the deletion. yes will remove the questionnaire cancel will stop the deletion action.
title: Questionnaire (Items)

text: if you are uncertain about which com-port the card terminal is connected to, use the below method: copy zvt-comm (program) to the customer's pc (desktop). close the pos program and test all com ports through zvt-comm in riab it's always com1 or com4.
title: Card terminal is not responding
