processing credit card payments, try connect to the till and terminate javaw.exe on the till and restart yespay (you may need to run yespay again and terminate it again). credit card: credit card machine chip&pin working but not swipe function first try and clean the card reader mechanism by using a fresh card machine cleaner (an enwrapped card coated with a special cleaning agent) to clean the swipe mechanism at the till. if the device swipe mechanism is still not reading a card, swap the credit card machine with a known working one. – importantly to note whilst carrying out this procedure is that you take note of which ports each card machine is plugged into as the devices are fixed to these ports. you will need to restart the till once the known working card machine is plugged into the till. credit card: verifone ocius setup – cardholder copy receipts not printing correctly problem when taking card payments at a terminal with verifone ocius software installed, two customer receipts are printed. one that includes the items purchased with hashed out debit/credit card details and another with a message stating “unable to retrieve data”. fix basically, during the verifone installation, the program.settings.ccf file which was configured to be located in the local merac installation folder. this file was not copied to this location following the installation. instead the file was located in the root (c:\) which the user has no access to and the pos till program is now looking in the local merac folder. move this file to c:\program files (x86)\merac. credit cards: integrated card machines payment cancel issue for merac ver 3.15, if you attempt to cancel an integrated card payment for a booking from the till, the transaction will be cancelled from the pdq but merac still registers the transaction but payments table is not updated with detail of the transaction which would indicate that the transaction was paid for successfully – which is what we would expect but the transaction details are still updated within the booking which makes it look like the booking was paid for. fix 1)add button to pos till - command – “disable integrated cc’ 2)recall booking from till and then refund the booking. 3)turn on integrated card payments again by reconfiguring the button using – command “enable integrated cc”. 4)advise the customer to attempt to take the customer not present payment again. problem with the above is that merac now thinks that no payment was taken for the booking because if you follow steps 2) and 3) at the same amount, they balance each other out which in effect means nothing was paid towards the booking as far as merac is concerning even though by pressing the command buttons below we know that ther customer has charged the card correctly. to fix this you would need to delete all offending transactions from the database! credit cards: corrupted log files causing issues taking card payments corrupt log files causing issues with taking card payments but this would need to be verified by yespay/worldpay. steps taken to un-corrupt/refresh yespay log files: 1. close easy v terminal application if running. 2. go to c:\yeseft\conf 3. rename yesefttransactionlog.xml file as backupyesefttransactionlog.xml. 4. make a copy of yesefttransactionlog-empty.xml file and rename as yesefttransactionlog.xml. 5 rename yesefttransactionlog-tmp.xml file as backupyesefttransactionlog-tmp.xml 6. make a copy of yesefttransactionlog-empty.xml file and rename as yesefttransactionlog-tmp.xml. 7. initialize easy v terminal twice then try to perform a transaction and share the result. 8. send us the backup copy of transaction log so we can check if there is any pending transaction to upload. hha error – there is some missing data for the membership when scanning an hha membership card from the pos terminal, if the below error appears. verify that mandatory information is included in the setup in the hha member details. in the below example, system options does not have any mandatory data required per membership setup… meracdata share drive mapping error using unc path membership card missing data error at pos till meracupdater customer notification message – meracupdater not working on a merac client sent from bluemail on 11 may 2017, at 03:20, customer notification > wrote: 11 may 2017 03:20:40 2017/05/11 03:20:40 - error in clssqlfunctions:getscalarvalue - desc:a transport-level error has occurred when receiving results from the server. (provider: tcp provider, error: 0 - the specified network name is no longer available.) sql:select isnull(upcforceupdatenextcheck,0) as upcforceupdatenextcheck from updateclient where upccomputername=@computername date 11 may 2017 03:20:40 customer name nottingham castle computer name ncm-notts-p2 ip address 192.168.1.231 appname meracupdater appmeracconnstrname server=81.174.163.111,14339;database=mstore;uid=applogin;pwd=vb6 fix select * from updateclient to workout what till it is. remotely connect and clear event viewer logs from windows and then replace meracupdater. till: unable to launch the pos till program when trying to run the till program, receive pmstore txread error. =================================================================== date and time: 24 may 2017 14:37:34 operator: error source: pmstore form/object: cdrawer sub/function: tillxread =================================================================== ----------------------------------------------------- error 91 -------------------------------------------------------- object variable or with block variable not set =================================================================== troubleshooting open up a new cashdraw and zread. compare the three files created on the new cashdraw with the cashdraw transaction files experiencing the issue to identify what the cause of the issue is. it would normally be something in the opening record that is causing the issue. may want to check if the userid used to open the cashdraw which appears in the opening record of the transaction file exists in the tills local meracdat.txt file emp line. workaround if the user account id does not exist, readme the id in the opening record to our merac id ‘100’.
title: 2017 Notes on MStore Trouble Shooting

text: table of contents definition declaring a major incident managing a major incident process diagram major incident log major incident manager instructions communication during the incident major incident report (story telling after the incident) key contacts for major incident managers definition major incidents are where multiple stores or multiple customers are experiencing a p1 caused by the same underlying issue. if there is only one customer affected by the same issue, please follow how to handle a p1. if it is a major incident: it is likely there is a financial impact on multiple customers i.e. affecting customers' immediate ability to trade, it could be a whole service being down (e.g. imagine). a major incident might also be declared if there is a potential significant financial impact on k3 because it may result in k3 having to pay compensation, or losing one or more major customers. declaring a major incident support receives a phone-call for a p1 incident (p1s should be raised by phone, but may be raised via other channels) support logs ticket and does initial triage. if triage reveals that one or more services are down (could happen for a p2 which you realise needs to be changed to a p1), or there is a performance issue so severe that effectively a service is down (i.e. multiple customers affected), create a tracker ticket and notify the major incident manager (mim) the mim will be the support manager for the region, or the most available support manager - uk: richard; europe: odd - if richard or odd is on holiday or not available/contactable (e.g. due to being on a customer site), then contact the manager who is available - if a mi occurs near the end of the european normal working hours, then it would usually make more sense for richard to be the mim if both odd and richard are available if further details are required to determine if it's a mi, mim asks support for further troubleshooting / info from customer. mim declares a major incident if appropriate and creates an internal master-ticket (which must be in english) managing a major incident if a major incident is declared, whoever is best to investigate/resolve the problem must drop their other work and work on this 100% until it is resolved this includes people from all teams in retail solutions all other tickets should be opened (per customer) and linked to the master problem ticket. mim starts a teams-chat with involved support and other staff trying to resolve the issue, and names it with the ticket number and product (e.g. k3cs-12345 imagine") mim provides management/stakeholder updates as per mim instructions below the impact and troubleshooting steps must be clear from the ticket description (see general ticket management) if support determines that help is required from other teams, dm will contact personnel for the appropriate product (see key contacts for duty managers) when you forward a major incident to a new function, they must be notified via chat or call and acknowledge ownership. if cross-team internal collaboration is required - mim will add them to the teams-chat and may set up and chair a taskforce meeting. actions must be documented concisely in teams-chat made and may be included and sent out to the retail solutions management team in the next update. when incident is resolved, mim ensures the ticket is closed mim declares major incident over and informs all parties within 1 week, mim writes and populates the master ticket with incident report. (can be done in resolved status) as soon as possible after the incident report, a root cause analysis and how we will prevent/mitigate this in future will be sent to all customers who contacted us during the incident. use existing tracker ticket is possible, but if time is exceeded, you may be required to open a new problem record with link to original incident. process diagram major incident handling process.vsdx major incident log the major incident log.xlsx is a list of all major incidents since october 2022. the completed reports can be found in cs global support - support leaders - major incident reports - all documents (sharepoint.com) major incident manager instructions the support major incident manager is accountable for the resolution of any major incidents communication during the incident mim posts to internal stakeholder/senior management teams chat during the incident - chat is named "retail solutions escalations (group chat for posting urgent customer issues)" mim sends management updates about the incident to the retail solutions escalations group teams chat every 2 hours (minimum) template for initial notification: summary including affected service/product: ticket number: customers affected: time of discovery: business impact: immediate actions: next update in: mim is a single point of contact (spoc) for escalations and major incidents if the mim is working with an incident, that must take priority over business as usual (bau) tasks until resolved. the mim is responsible for setting up a group chat with involved team/people who are trying to find the cause and resolve the mi. major incident report (story telling after the incident) a major incident report is for internal use (after the incident has been resolved, and within 1 week of it being resolved). the major incident report should be sent to appropriate distribution list, depending on the products and customers affected. you will need to get a root cause from the product owner assuming a software or infrastructure issue was the cause. when you are writing an incident report, you are telling a story. anyone who reads an incident report needs to understand what has happened, when and by which team. use timelines and team names. the template report to take a copy from is ci-000 (ca-xxxxx) major incident report template.docx which is in the folder of all previous major incident reports cs global support - support leaders - major incident reports key contacts for major incident managers in case of major incidents, these are the main contacts you can use to help investigate and resolve incidents (and these people may not be able to help, but should know who can if not) who is on out of hours shifts shifts are managed in a single shift app in ms teams ("retail solutions customer support" team). imagine development contacts as per imagine platform issues if other team members required or escalation required, contact matt warr ddd/riab development contacts: ddd backoffice: søren jansen backup: torben christensen ddd pos: rene andersen it-relation - now itm8 itm8 mads røn nielsen, problem manager phone +45 7026 2988 mail servicedesk@itrelation.dk itm8 michael ahrendt-petersen, service delivery manager phone +45 2156 6937 mail: miape@itm8.com see operating status - driftsinformation | itm8 mstore backoffice - paul marquick or alex armstrong for web dave radford (product owner) for anything else/if you can't contact the above, or if you need help with the developers matt warr manages all retail solutions development teams, so he is the single point of development escalation node4 node4 sre - tom grantham node 4 incident management node4 service desk (0800 054 1220)
title: Major Incident Management

text: important: before actioning any errors for wellcome we need to first ensure the error is valid. sometimes we may receive an automated error from dsw but in fact the file has uploaded correctly. in this scenario if the error is actioned this will result in the sales being duplicated. since we don’t have access to the unit4 system, reach out to the following people at wellcome to check first: r.syed@wellcome.org t.appleby@wellcome.org brief overview of the flow the ‘sales transaction scheduled [imagine -- unit4]’ flow exports a days’ worth of sales from imagine, converts it to an xml file and uploads this file to the unit4 system where the sales get imported. the flow uses a variable to know what days sales to pull from imagine. the logic behind the date setting is (currentdate + *dayselection*) where the dayselection variable is typically ‘-1’. there is currently no logic on the flow to avoid uploading duplicate data. care must be taken when running the flow manually to ensure the dayselection variable is set correctly. updating the dayselection variable when running the flow manually you may specify a date to run by updating the date variable. the date variable is calculated against the current date. for example, if you were trying to run the flow on the 10th july and want to resend sales from the 5th july you’d need to update the variable to ‘-5’ and execute the flow. to update the variable click on the ‘manage’ tab against the flow and click on the variables button: find the ‘dayselection’ variable and update the value to what you need: important: remember to change this back to ‘-1’ after executing the flow. actioning the errors typically, most errors will likely be resolved by clicking ‘retry from step’ on the specific datastep that failed. if this doesn’t work, then further investigation will need to be done. you may wish to try running the flow manually, but you must ensure the dayselection variable is updated to avoid posting duplicate transactions. when attempting to ‘retry from step’ the dayselection variable doesn’t need to be updated provided the flow failed after the ‘set dates for cash api’ step.
title: Actioning Wellcome DSW Email Errors

text: when we receive an order to setup a new pos for a butik,the frist thing is to install a dddpos programme on the new pos. the installation process is done by selecting a normal/general pos programme. the setup for a general pos normally look like this when we click on ddd in the pos. we have a lot of customers that have subscription for ddd riab and the settings on the pos must be changed to riab for that particular customer. the procedure to do it is as follows. go to customers ddd admin and advanced configuration.in this example i am considering customer number/klient id 819059. go to edi tools editoobox @ root.login (dddretail.com) login with your details username support and password dddsupp search for customer advanced configuration menu from ddd admin enter the password ddd+2016 in order to make changes in configuration search for 2 paramenters show item management and large accounts and change its value to 1 as shown below. save the settings by selecting save button at the end of the page run a reload command on the kasse in the clerk menu and restart the computer in order to make the changes happen. after reloading pos program the customer can now see all the setttings/menus for a riab in pos.
title: POS-How to convert POS into RIAB

text: if the shop assistants can't log in (they type in their number and nothing happens), the pos program needs to be restarted through task manager. 1. in teamviewer, under actions, choose the send ctrl-alt-delete 2. choose task manager 3. choose the pos program and click end task 4. scroll down to any ddd instances, choose them and click end task 5. scroll further down and check if there are any other backgroundprocesse s open called anything with pos in them and shut them down too (there's usually ony 1). 6. close the task manager and restart the pos program. now they should be able to log in. an alternative, that the customer can perform themselves, is to shut down the pc, leave it off for about 30 seconds, and then turn it back on. that works too.
title: Shop assistants - can't log in (RIAB - Cecil/SO/CBR)

text: if a customer is running the voucher usage report in their online back office portal, then their rep_voucherusage stored procedure on their website database needs to be updated to have the below variables to be varchar(30). @strfromdate varchar(20), @strtodate varchar(20) this is because the website sends the dates in this format, which is longer than 20 characters. exec rep_voucherusage @strvouchercode='night10',@strfromdate='1/november/2024',@strtodate='9/november/2024 23:59:59' this is the full stored procedure below. use [wwwdatabasename] go /****** object: storedprocedure [dbo].[rep_voucherusage] script date: 23/11/2024 13:10:41 ******/ set ansi_nulls on go set quoted_identifier on go alter procedure [dbo].[rep_voucherusage] -- add the parameters for the stored procedure here @strvouchercode varchar(20), @strfromdate varchar(30), @strtodate varchar(30) as begin -- set nocount on added to prevent extra result sets from -- interfering with select statements. set nocount on; -- insert statements for procedure here select localbkgdet._bookingref as [booking ref], localbkghdr.bkgcomplete as [complete], localbkghdr.bkgemailsent as [emailed], localbkghdr.bkgpaid as [paid], localbkghdr.bkgrecstatus as [status], convert(varchar(5), localsb.sbqty) + ' x ' + localsb.sbitemdesc as [desc], (select pricelookups.plufootfall from bkgresources inner join barcodes on bkgresources.bkrcode = barcodes.bcdcode inner join pricelookups on barcodes.bcdplurecno = pricelookups.plurecno where (bkgresources.bkrresno = localsb.sbpid)) * localsb.sbqty as footfall, internetvouchers.ivovouchercode as [voucher code], internetvouchers.ivoname as [voucher promo], localsb.sbtotalamount as revenue from localbkghdr inner join internetvouchers on localbkghdr.bkgvoucherid = internetvouchers.ivoid inner join localbkgdet on localbkghdr.bkgid = localbkgdet.bkgid inner join localsb on localbkgdet.detid = localsb.sbbkgid where (localsb.sbshopitem = 0 and localbkghdr.bkgrecstatus = 'b') and (internetvouchers.ivovouchercode like @strvouchercode) and bkginitdate between convert(datetime,@strfromdate) and convert(datetime,@strtodate) end
title: No Results Were Returned When Running Online Voucher Usage Report

text: de functie alarmvoorwaarde is bedoeld om een tabel zodanig weer te geven dat bepaalde waarden extra opvallen of juist om bepaalde waarden weg te laten. op deze wijze kunnen de meest belangrijke data bij de gebruiker extra onder de aandacht worden gebracht. bijvoorbeeld door waarden in een afwijkende kleur of ander lettertype weer te geven. het scherm ziet er vervolgens als volgt uit: in het keuzevak aan de linkerzijde staan de reeds opgeslagen alarmvoorwaarden. invoeren nieuwe alarmvoorwaarde opslaan van een ingevoerde alarmvoorwaarde verwijderen van een geselecteerde alarmvoorwaarde aan de hand van de onderstaande invoervelden kan een nieuwe alarmvoorwaarde worden vastgelegd of een bestaande worden gewijzigd. kies na het invoeren of wijzigen het symbool opslaan. beschikbare posten - gebruikte posten alvorens een alarmvoorwaarde wordt aangemaakt moet hier worden aangegeven welke variabelen gebruikt gaan worden in de voorwaarde. klik hiervoor in het vak beschikbare posten op de gewenste variabele en klik vervolgens op het symbool (toevoegen). de variabele wordt verplaatst naar het van 'gebruikte posten' en kan vervolgens in een alarmvoorwaarde worden gebruikt. bijvoorbeeld: een alarmfunctie heeft betrekking op de variabele verkoop.verk_vk_werk, dus v14 vanuit het blok 'beschikbare posten' toevoegen aan het blok 'gebruikte posten'. let op kies alleen variabelen die ook zijn gekozen in het tabblad design. om een variabele te verwijderen uit het vak gebruikte posten klik op de gewenste variabele en klik vervolgens op het symbool (verwijderen). overige functies in deze velden zijn: alle variabelen toevoegen alle variabelen verwijderen alarmvoorwaarde in dit vak moet de daadwerkelijke voorwaarde worden vastgelegd. indien de waarden in de tabel voldoen aan deze voorwaarde, zullen deze afwijkend worden weergeven volgens de bij deze voorwaarde behorende en opgeslagen instellingen welke hieronder worden beschreven. de alarmvoorwaarde dient rekenkundig te worden ingevoerd waarbij de volgende tekens gebruikt moeten worden: - formule moet beginnen met een van de volgende tekens: = resultaat is een absolute waarde - vervolgens moet worden aangegeven voor welke variabelen de voorwaarden gelden vxx basis variabelen uxx variabelen welke door de gebruiker zijn gedefinieerd (calculatievariabelen) - logische operatoren > groter dan >= gelijk aan of groter dan 40000 let op - bij gebruik van meerdere alarmvoorwaarden, dienen de separate voorwaardes gescheiden te worden door haken - bij eur waardes wordt uitgegaan van x-aantal cijfers achter de komma - bij het ingeven van een waarde (eur) bij de alarmvoorwaarde dient een punt gebruikt te worden om de scheiding aan te geven tussen de getallen voor en na de komma niveau geldigheid voor welk niveau van de tabel geldt de alarmvoorwaarde. voorbeeld voorwaarde geldt uitsluitend voor niveau 1 zichtbaar indien aan de alarmvoorwaarde wordt voldaan, kan het volgende hier ingesteld worden: - verbergen: waardes binnen de alarmvoorwaarden niet tonen (verbergen) - tonen: uitsluitend waardes binnen de alarmvoorwaarde tonen - niets aanvinken: alle waardes van de tabel worden getoond. de optie 'niets aanvinken' heeft dus alleen zin wanneer wordt gekozen voor een andere weergaven van de waardes welke vallen binnen de alarmvoorwaarden. voorbeeld niet aanvinken, aangezien uitsluitende de omzetten groter eur 40000 in het rood weergegeven dienen te worden. data validity bij dit veld dient aangegeven te worden of de instellingen gelden voor: - cel uitsluitend een item (cel) wordt verborgen of weergegeven (al dan niet in kleur, groter lettertype etc); - rij de gehele rij waar de waarde zicht in bevindt, wordt verborgen of weergegeven (al dan niet in kleur, groter lettertype etc). voorbeeld row aanvinken, aangezien bijvoorbeeld de gehele rij in een andere kleur weergegeven dient te worden. lettertype eigenschappen in dit blok kan aangegeven worden dat waardes welke voldoen aan de alarmvoorwaarde weergegeven dienen te worden op een afwijkende manier: lettertype grootte stijl van het lettertype kleur van het lettertype. wanneer een kleur wordt geselecteerd, wordt automatisch de melding 'used background colors' aangevinkt. deze melding kan ook aangevinkt worden, waarbij de reeds ingestelde kleur wordt gebruikt het aangeven van afwijkende eigenschappen van het lettertype heeft alleen zin, wanneer in het blok 'zichtbaar' niet aangevinkt staat. voorbeeld via een klik op kan de kleur van het lettertype aangepast worden (rood) alarmlijst nadat de instellingen van een alarm zijn vastgelegd, dienen deze gegevens opgeslagen te worden (klik op ). in de alarmlijst wordt de alarmfunctie opgenomen. voorbeeld: voer naam van de alarmfunctie in (test) en druk op enter let op wanneer in een tabel dezelfde waardes van verschillende periodes worden getoond, dient achter de variabele de periode tussen rechte haken geplaatst te worden. deze naam dient gelijk te zijn aan de naam van de variabele in het tabblad design. nadat de voorwaarden van de alarmfuncties zijn ingevoerd, en deze is opgeslagen, kan worden teruggekeerd naar het tabblad design, waar de resultaten van de geactiveerde alarmfunctie(s) worden getoond.
title: MARS - Alarm instellen

text: het resultaatcijfer in mars is een vaste variabele. de rentabiliteit is het cijfer wat weergeeft hoeveel euro omzet gegenereerd kan worden met investering van 1 euro. indien het cijfer 410 wordt vermeldt wil dit zeggen dat met investering van 1 euro 4,10 omzet gerealiseerd kan worden. de rentabiliteit wordt altijd berekend op basis van de vos_jaar. hier dient een eigen variabele te worden aangemaakt door middel van een calculatieveld (zie handleiding of vraag k3unisoft om advies). de standaardvariabelen in mars berekenen namelijk de rentabiliteit op andere wijze en komt niet overeen met de door de nederlandse retailers gehanteerde rekenmethode. rentabiliteit formule = ((vos_jaar * netto marge(ex btw)) / (100 – netto marge(ex btw)) * 100 hieronder zie je het verschil in uitkomst tussen de “nederlandse” manier van berekenen uit de vaste variabele uit mars
title: MARS - Het resultaatcijfer RVE/MARS

negative total 1=signature receipt if min. one negative line. askforcustomerinfo 0 = default collecting information to external crm system. data can be downloaded from peoplecollector.dddadmin.com 0 = don’t ask for customer information 1 = ask for costumer information askforforegingiftcertificateinfo 0 = default when redeeming old gift vouchers, you can state the number of the old gift voucher. there will be a file in the pos folder called foreighngift.txt containing date,number,amount. made for björn borg in sweden. 0 = don’t ask for gift voucher number 1 = ask for gift voucher number askforreturncode 0 = default give a returnreason. the code must for now be given by a script directly in the database. the return reasoncode will be accessible in ddd report in q3 2013 0 = don’t ask text: in riab,reports can be ordered in the menu called reports as shown in the below screenshot. when a report is ordered,it should appear in the print out in a couple of seconds. sometime,there are errors and reports are not generated. in such case,restarting the pos can sometime resolve the problem. if the error is related to bad communication between servers(web server is not communicating with ftp server) so the customer will receive the following error. in such case,a ticket must be created for the development team so they can work on it. please note that the drift team must have information,which server the pos is communicating. this information can be found on the main interface of the pos as shown below. in the below case,the webserver is 13 and drift must have this information.
title: Error while retrieving reports-RIAB

text: login into your cowis system service logische etiketten choose the label you want to edit click on it one time, click on ändern, choose layout ändern now you can use l&l to edit your label, don't forget to save
title: Label layout in Cowis - how to edit

text: save the logo in e.g. cowiskasse -> vorlagen (size and format is irrelevant. cowis accepts all formats and sizes) open cowis pos -> funktion check that the right printer is installed (e.g. zebra tlp) system -> logische drucker click abbruch (cancel) click service and sign on as cowsys (pw c0w15!) click schließen to close that window click allgemein -> ersatzetikett drucken choose random article by clicking ok choose a random article and clik ok click ja on design anpassen (adjust design) choose einfügen (insert) click bild (picture) with left mousekey, create a field at the top of the label choose datei (file) locate and choose the logo you saved beforehand and click öffnen (open) you can adjust the placement of the logo, but not the size. click save you get a print preview of the label. clck druckvorschau schließen ask customer to test if the setup is correct.
title: New logo on exchange label

text: riab inventory is slightly different from ddd inventory, since it is started and finished on the pos and not through backoffice. if the client has entered a wrong date as a start date, this can be corrected until the inventory is completed. after that, it is no longer possible. to delete the date (or, in some cases, the entire inventory if something has gone wrong and they need to start over), they have to delete either the start date or the entire inventory. 1. click on the ddd button 2. choose delete under inventory 3. select delete inventory (attention!!! do not choose inventory files if it is only to change the dates) if they want to delete everything, including transfered data, they should choose delete inventory data (slet optællingsdata) instead. they just need to be very sure that they want to delete everthing they have counted and start over again. 4. enter the password for the logged in user (attention: this can only be done if the user has a password. inventory cannot be deleted without one. if the user does not have a password, either log in with a user with a password or log into backoffice and delete the inventory data from there. if this is not possible, add a password to a shop assistant, that then can be used.) 5. click delete if only the date has been deleted, follow the below steps to start a new status with the same data already uploaded. 6. return to the ddd section and click start inventory 7. enter the correct dates, choose full inventory and click start 8. and then continue as usual.
title: Delete RIAB Inventory

text: when a german customer gets a new card terminal, the following change has to be made to get the pos to communicate with the new terminal: 1. open pos/program/bin/debug/printer/configuration/esc koder.txt 2. scroll down to [germanbankingconfig] 3. change port to com1 (if different) 4. change stopbit to 2 (if different) 5. restart pos if it still doesn't work, repeat above steps and set stopbit to 1.

text: when printing occasionally sites will get the below error: this means the till cannot find the logo set on the receipt (or additional picture in some cases). check which receipt design the till is using: click on the glasses icon to check the receipt design: on the till browse to c:\programdata\merac\graphics ensure that the picture file exists, in this case k3logo.jpg: sometimes the picture is not able to be opened (will generally just show a white icon). in this instance delete it and restart merac updater. it should then pull the file down correctly from the server. may be named incorrectly. ensure that within receipt designer the name is specified correctly. occasionally the copy of the picture on the server has got corrupt. get a working copy of the image, place it into the graphics folder and re-create till data from that till. it will then save that copy of the picture to the database.
title: Object Variable or With block variable not set - CCDocHeader

text: table of contents what is database optimisation? why optimise your k3 application database? who is responsible? how can k3 help? k3’s experts steps to an optimised database additional options database backups disaster recovery testing archiving next steps what is database optimisation? database optimisation is the process of using various database manufacturer tools to fine tune their efficiency and maximise the speed at which it works. the tools need configuring, monitoring, and the results evaluated to achieve this. why optimise your k3 application database? in a dynamic business landscape, ensuring fast and reliable application responses from your database infrastructure is paramount. k3 applications have a database to store information such as transactions, customer records, configuration and much more. if you have a database which is not performing very well, you may find that responses in the application are slow, or even time-out, preventing you from running your business effectively. this is easily avoided if you have the right technical procedures in place to ensure this doesn’t happen. who is responsible? k3 offer a cloud hosted database service, but if you are hosting the database on your own infrastructure, then your it team are responsible for its maintenance. we provide guidance for some products on how your it team can keep the database in the best condition (see this article for logged-in users), but if your team does not include database experts, then for a minimal cost we can help you avoid costly issues with availability and performance of your database. how can k3 help? k3’s experts we have product and databases experts ready to provide assurance that your database is performing the best it can on your server. these experts already manage our cloud database hosting service for customers, and so have the product and database technical experience to know what’s best for your application database. importantly, they know how to tune, but then also maintain that state of tune as your database grows and changes over time. steps to an optimised database the fixed price database optimisation and maintenance plan consist of the stages below. initialisation perform diagnostic checks on the database and run tools to optimise it we will also recommend any changes you might need to make on your server (e.g. if it does not have enough space or memory). validate your backup regime meet requirements k3 are not responsible for your database backups, but we can make sure it is being backed up to the local server for your own tools to copy off the server, and advise if you need to implement anything additional. configure and schedule a regular maintenance plan the optimisation tasks will run weekly outside of the hours your business is open. monitoring and verification alerts will be configured from your database to email k3 support directly if there are issues reported by the database, support will act upon those tickets from the email quickly which will be raised as a priority 2 by default. monthly inspection once a month, we will log on to your server and inspect it manually to make sure all optimisation routines are as expected, and that they are having an effect. you will be provided with a brief report giving you the assurance that everything is ok. annual health check at the beginning of each subsequent year since the plan commenced, the same diagnostic steps will be performed as the initialisation phase which includes recommendations which might have changed due to any changes on the server (some servers host more than the k3 product database, so there are many variables). what happens if there’s a problem? the database optimisation and maintenance plan is provided on a fixed price basis per database. if any of the checks find an issue that we need to spend time investigating and resolving, then we will do this on a time and materials basis at the applicable standard rate. an example of this work would be if the database has grown too large and you would like us to archive some data. additional options the following can optionally be added to the database optimisation and maintenance plan database backups ensuring your data is backed up in the case of a major incident is essential in any business continuity plan. we will give you the comfort of knowing that backups are being created successfully (at a schedule you define - e.g. every night) which will include making sure that they are the expected size, location, and number of old versions kept. frequency: checking backups would be part of the monthly monitoring and verification stage described previously. disaster recovery testing if you have subscribed to the optional extra of verifying that database backups are being created, you can also add on that we will do a disaster recovery test. this takes your assurance that you are ready for anything to the next level by taking your most recent backup, connecting it to the k3 back office and till programs, and ensuring the integrity of the database backup. frequency: this can be done as often as required by the customer – we would recommend at least every 6 months. archiving if you would like to regularly archive your data, we can add this to the database optimisation and maintenance plan. sometimes a database can grow so large that it impacts performance, even if all the other industry standard maintenance actions are taking place. data that can be archived includes dormant customers, and transactions older than a certain number of years. the archived data is kept in a separate database for you to backup and keep. frequency: this can be done as often as required by the customer. we would perform analysis on the database first and provide a recommendation. next steps contact your k3 customer success manager to discuss what best fits your needs, and how we can work together to give you optimum performance and business continuity. download our brochure if you would like to discuss this with your team.
title: K3 MStore Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan
